modules.description: Handles user authentication and token validation for accessing user-specific Spotify data. It provides functions to serialize and deserialize user data, as well as check token expiration. Useful for maintaining valid user sessions and securely accessing user-specific resources like playlists or listening history.

This module implements client-side interactions with the Spotify Web API, handling authentication flows, token management, and HTTP requests. It works with types like `t` for client configuration, `User.t` for authenticated user data, and error types for handling API failures such as token expiration or rate limiting. Concrete use cases include redirecting users to Spotify for login, exchanging authorization codes for tokens, refreshing expired tokens, and making authenticated API requests to access user-specific data like playlists or listening history.

This module implements direct bindings to Spotify Web API endpoints, returning structured data like user top tracks, artist details, album metadata, and track information. It handles authentication flow integration and response parsing into typed records for consumption. Functions like `user_top_tracks` retrieve ranked listening history, while types like `track` and `artist` model Spotify's resource schema for downstream processing or UI display.

This module provides direct access to Spotify Web API functionality, including retrieving user top tracks, artist details, and album metadata through structured, typed responses. It supports client-side authentication flows, token management, and HTTP request handling for interacting with user-specific data like playlists and listening history. Concrete use cases include fetching ranked listening data, managing Spotify user sessions, and integrating Spotify resource data into applications.
